oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Collections LibGuides: An Analysis of Uses and Accessibility
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Reese, Jacquelyn Slater
McCain, Cheryl
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: special collections
LibGuides
outreach
online guides
accessibility
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Content management systems (CMS) such as SpringShareâ€™s LibGuides have become a popular method of creating online pathfinders or subject guides. At the same time, special collections have explored new digital ways to reach their users. Ease of access and simple navigation are key to reaching all types of users. Special collections have explored different ways to use a traditional subject guide system to meet their unique needs. This article investigates the navigation pathway to special collections LibGuides at Greater Western Library Alliance (GWLA) member institutions and analyzes the different ways special collections are using this tool.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Practical Academic Librarianship: The International Journal of the SLA Academic Division; Vol. 7 No. 1 (2017); 1-12
